label: Labels define different sections in your script.
text: The text keyword is used to display dialogues.
choice: The choice keyword allows users to make choices in the script.
jump: The jump keyword declares that after executing the previous keyword proceed to the provided label.
after: The after keyword in a label specifies the action to be taken after the execution of the label.
say: When added to a text, defines which character will be added as the speaking character.
sound: Defines a sound asset to be played when this label is processed.
bg: Defines a background image asset to be displayed when this label is processed. Includes extension.
character: Defines a character to be shown during this label.
exp: When added to a character definition, defines which expression that character will display.
start-dialogue: Defines which label will be processed first when this script is loaded.
end-dialogue: After this label is executed, conclude the script.
